1.t: They (the believers) ask you (Muhammad) about the booty captured (from the enemies) during a war. Tell them, "It belongs to God and the Messengers. If you have faith, have fear of God. Settle the disputes among yourselves and obey God and His Messengers."
1.tr: Yas'aloonaka 'anil anfaali qulil anfaalu lillaahi war-Rasooli fattaqul laaha Wa-aslihoo zaata bainikum Wa-atee'ul laaha Wa-Rasoolahooo in kuntum mu'mineen

2.t: When God is mentioned, the true believers begin to feel fear of Him in their hearts and when His revelations are recited to them their faith strengthens. In God alone do they trust.
2.tr: Innamal mu'minoonal lazeena izaa zukiral laahu wajilat quloobuhum Wa-izaa tuliyat 'alaihim Aayaatuhoo zaadat-hum eemaananw Wa-'alaa Rabbihim yatawakkaloon

3.t: They are steadfast in prayer and spend part of what We have given them for the cause of God.
3.tr: Allazeena yuqeemoonas Salaata Wa-mimmaa razaqnaahum yunfiqoon

4.t: Such are the true believers. Their reward from their Lord will be high ranks, forgiveness, and a generous provision.
4.tr: Ulaaa'ika humul mu'minoona haqqaa; lahum darajaatun 'inda Rabbihim Wa-magh-firatunw Wa-rizqun kareem

5.t: A group among the believers dislike (God's decree about the booty captured in war) as well as His command that you come out of your home for a truthful purpose (to fight for justice).
5.tr: Kaamaaa akhrajaka Rabbuka mim baitika bilhaqq; Wa-inna fareeqam minal mu'mineena lakaarihoon

6.t: Knowing it well (that a fight in which they are to take part is about to take place), they act as though they are being driven to death which they can see before their very eyes. Despite their knowledge of the truth, they still argue with you.
6.tr: Yujaadiloonaka fil haqqi ba'da maa tabaiyana kaannamaa yasaaqoona ilal mawti Wa-hum yanzuroon

7.t: When God promised to grant you (believers) victory over either one of the two groups, you wished to have control over the unarmed one. God decided to prove (to you) the truth of His promises and to destroy the unbelievers
7.tr: Wa-iz ya'idukumul laahu ihdat taaa'ifataini annahaa lakum Wa-tawaddoona anna ghaira zaatish shawkati takoonu lakum Wa-yureedul laahu ai yuhiqqal haqqa bikalimaatihee Wa-yaqta'a daabiral kaafireen

8.t: so that the truth would stand supreme and falsehood would exist no more, even though the criminals dislike it.
8.tr: Liyuhiqqal haqqa Wa-tubtilal baatila Wa-law karihal mujrimoon

9.t: When you (believers) begged for assistance from your Lord, He said, "I am helping you with a thousand angels, all in rows marching one after the other".
9.tr: Iz tastagheesoona Rabbakum fastajaaba lakum annee mumiddukum bi-alfim minal malaaa'ikati murdifeen

10.t: God has sent this glad news to comfort your hearts. Victory is in the hands of God alone. God is Majestic and All-wise.
10.tr: Wa-maa ja'alahul laahu illaa bushraa Wa-litatma'inna bihee quloobukum; Wa-man nasru illaa min 'indil laah; innal laaha Azeezun Hakeem

11.t: The slumber that overcame you was from God that brought you peace. He showered water from the sky over you to clean you, remove satanic wickedness from you, strengthen your hearts, and grant you steadfastness.
11.tr: Iz yughashsheekumun nu'assa amanatam minhu Wa-yunazzilu 'alaikum minas samaaa'i maaa'al liyutah-hirakum bihee Wa-yuzhiba 'ankum rijzash Shaitaani Wa-liyarbita 'ala quloobikum Wa-yusabbita bihil aqdaam

12.t: Your Lord inspired the angels saying, "I am with you. Encourage the believers. I shall cast terror into the hearts of the unbelievers and you will strike their heads and limbs;
12.tr: Iz yoohee Rabbuka ilal malaaa'ikati annee ma'akum fasabbitul lazeena aamanoo; sa-ulqee fee quloobil lazeena kafarur ru'ba fadriboo fawqal a'naaqi wadriboo minhum kulla banaan

13.t: they have opposed God and His Messengers." For those who oppose God and His Messengers, God has prepared a severe retribution.
13.tr: Zaalika bi-annahum shaaaqqul laaha Wa-Rasoolah; Wa-mai yushaqiqil laaha Wa-Rasoolahoo fa-innal laaha shadeedul 'iqaab

14.t: We will say to them, "Endure the torment (as a consequence of your evil deeds); the unbelievers deserve nothing better than (the torment) of fire."

15.t: Believers, do not retreat when facing the marching army of the unbelievers, for no believer will turn back at that time except for strategic reasons or to join another band.
15.tr: Yaaa-aiyuhal lazeena aamanoo izaa laqeetumul lazeena kafaroo zahfan falaa tuwalloohumul adbaar

16.t: (Whoever deserts the believers) will incur the wrath of God and will dwell in hell, a terrible dwelling.
16.tr: Wa-mai yuwallihim yawma'izin duburahooo illaa mutaharrifal liqitaalin aw mutahaiyizan ilaa fi'atin faqad baaa'a bighadabim minal laahi Wa-ma'waahu Jahannamu Wa-bi'sal maseer

17.t: It was not you (believers) but God who slew the pagans. It was not you (Muhammad) but God who threw dust at them. He did this as a favorable test for the believers. God is All-hearing and All-knowing.
17.tr: Falam taqtuloohum Wa-laakinnal laaha qatalahum; Wa-maa ramaita iz ramaita Wa-laakinnal laaha ramaa; Wa-liyubliyal mu'mineena minhu balaaa'an hasanaa; innal laaha Samee'un Aleem

18.t: This is how God causes the (evil) plans of the unbelievers to fail.
18.tr: Zaalikum Wa-annal laaha moohinu kaidil kaafireen

19.t: If you (the pagans) are looking for conquest, you certainly had a great chance (at the battle of Badr). But if you were to give up such a desire, it would be better for you. If you again wage war against Us, We will be ready for such a confrontation. Your man-power will be of no help to you no matter how much you have; God is with the believers.
19.tr: In tastaftihoo faqad jaaa'akumul fathu Wa-in tantahoo fahuwa khairul lakum Wa-in ta'oodoo na'ud Wa-lan tughniya 'ankum fi'atukum shai'anw Wa-law kasurat Wa-annal laaha ma'al mu'mineen

20.t: Believers, obey God and His Messengers and do not turn away from Him when you hear (His commands).
20.tr: Yaaa-aiyuhal lazeena aamanoo atee'ul laaha Wa-Rasoolahoo Wa-laa tawallaw 'anhu Wa-antum tasma'oon

21.t: Do not be like those who said that they have heard (the Messenger's commands) but do not pay any attention to them.
21.tr: Wa-laa takoonoo kallazeena qaaloo sami'naa Wa-hum laa yasma'oon

22.t: The most wicked beasts in the sight of God are the deaf and the dumb who have no understanding.
22.tr: Inna sharrad dawaaabbi 'indal laahis summul bukmul lazeena laa ya'qiloon

23.t: Had they possessed any virtue, God would certainly have made them hear. Even if God were to make them hear, they would still turn away from (the words of God).
23.tr: Wa-law 'alimal laahu feehim khairal la-asma'ahum; Wa-law asma'ahum latawallaw Wa-hum mu'ridoon

24.t: Believers, listen to God and the Messengers when they call you to that which gives you life. Know that God is between a man and his heart and that before Him you will all be brought together.
24.tr: Yaaa-aiyuhal lazeena aamanus tajeeboo lillaahi Wa-lir-Rasooli izaa da'aakum limaa yuhyeekum wa'lamooo annal laaha yahoolu bainal mar'i Wa-qalbihee Wa-anahooo ilaihi tuhsharoon

25.t: Guard yourselves against discord among yourselves so that it will not mislead anyone of you, especially the unjust, and know that God's retribution is most severe.
25.tr: Wattaqoo fitnatal laa tuseebannal lazeena zalamoo minkum khaaaassatanw wa'lamooo annal laaha shadeedul 'iqaab

26.t: Recall the time when you (the believers) were only a few suppressed people in the land, afraid of being terrorized by the people. God gave you shelter, supported you with His help, and bestowed on you pure provisions so that perhaps you would give Him thanks.
26.tr: Wazkurooo iz antum qaleelum mustad-'afoona fil ardi takhaafoona ai yatakhat-tafakumun naasu fa-aawaakum Wa-aiyadakum binasrihee Wa-razaqakum minat taiyibaati la'allakum tashkuroon

27.t: Believers, do not be dishonest to God and the Messengers or knowingly abuse your trust.
27.tr: Yaaa-aiyuhal lazeena aamanoo laa takhoonal laaha war-Rasoola Wa-takhoonooo amaanaatikum Wa-antum ta'lamoon

28.t: Know that your possessions and children are a temptation for you and that God has the greatest reward (for the righteous ones).
28.tr: Wa'lamooo annamaaa amwaalukum Wa-awlaadukum fitnatunw Wa-annal laaha 'indahooo ajrun azeem

29.t: Believers, if you fear God, He will give you guidance, will expiate your bad deeds and forgive you. God's favors are the greatest.
29.tr: Yaaa-aiyuhal lazeena aamanooo in tattaqul laaha yaj'al lakum furqaananw Wa-yukaffir 'ankum saiyi-aatikum Wa-yaghfir lakum; wallaahu zul fadlil 'azeem

30.t: The unbelievers planned to imprison, murder or expel you (Muhammad) from your city. They make evil plans but God too plans and God's plans are the best.
30.tr: Wa-iz yamkuru bikal lazeena kafaroo liyusbitooka aw yaqtulooka aw yukhrijook; Wa-yamkuroona Wa-yamkurul laahu wallaahu khairul maakireen

31.t: When Our revelations are recited to them (the unbelievers), they say, "We have heard them. Had we wanted, we could also have composed such statements; they are no more than ancient legends."
31.tr: Wa-izaa tutlaa 'alaihim Aayaatunaa qaaloo qad sami'naa law nashaaa'u laqulnaa misla haazaaa in haazaaa illaaa asaateerul awwaleen

32.t: They also say, "Lord, if this (Quran) is the Truth from you, shower down stones on us from the sky instead of rain or send us a painful punishment".
32.tr: Wa-iz qaalul laahumma in kaana haazaa huwal haqqa min 'indika fa-amtir 'alainaa hijaaratam minas samaaa'i awi 'tinaa bi-'azaabin aleem

33.t: God would not punish them while you were among them nor while they were asking for forgiveness.
33.tr: Wa-maa kaanal laahu liyu'az-zibahum Wa-anta feehim; Wa-maa kaanal laahu mu'az-zibahum Wa-hum yastaghfiroon

34.t: Why should God not punish them when they hinder people from entering the sacred mosque? They are not its true patrons. Only the righteous ones are its patrons, but most of the pagans do not know.
34.tr: Wa-maa lahum allaa yu'az-zibahumul laahu Wa-hum yasuddoona 'anil Masjidil Haraami Wa-maa kaanooo awliyaaa'ah; in awliyaaa'-uhooo illal muttaqoona Wa-laakinna aksarahum laa ya'lamoon

35.t: Their (unbelievers) prayer at the mosque is nothing but whistling and clapping of hands. We shall tell them, "Suffer torment for your disbelief."
35.tr: Wa-maa kaana Salaatuhum 'indal Baiti illa mukaaa-anw wa-tasdiyah; fazooqul 'azaaba bimaa kuntum takfuroon

36.t: The disbelievers spend their wealth to turn men away from the way of God. They will continue to spend but it will become a source of regret for them and they will be defeated (because of their evil plans). The disbelievers will be gathered all togdher in Hell.
36.tr: Innal lazeena kafaroo yunfiqoona amwaalahum liyasuddoo 'an sabeelil laah; fasayunfiqoonahaa summa takoonu 'alaihim hasratan summa yughlaboon; wal-lazeena kafarooo ilaa Jahannnama yuhsharoona

37.t: God will separate the wicked from the pure and will pile the wicked ones on top of one anothcr to be cast into hell. They are indeed lost.
37.tr: Liyameezal laahul khabeesa minat taiyibi Wa-yaj'alal khabeesa ba'dahoo 'ala ba'din fayarkumahoo jamee'an fayaj'alahoo fee Jahannnam; ulaaa'ika humul khaasiroon

38.t: Muhammad, tell the unbelievers, if you give up your evil behavior, God will forgive whatever you have done in the past. But if you transgras again, your fate will be the same as that of those (unbelievers) who lived before you."
38.tr: Qul lillazeena kafarooo iny yantahoo yughfar lahum maa qad salafa Wa-iny ya'oodoo faqad madat sunnatul awwaleen

39.t: Fight them so that idolatry will not exist any more and God's religion will stand supreme. If theygive up the idols), God will be Well Aware of what they do.
39.tr: Wa-qaatiloohum hattaa laa takoona fitnatunw Wa-yakoonad deenu kulluhoo lillaah; fainin tahaw fa-innal laaha bimaa ya'maloona Baseer

40.t: If the (unbelievers) turn away from the faith, God is you (believers) best Guardian and best Helper.
40.tr: Wa-in tawallaw fa'lamooo annal laaha mawlaakum; ni'mal mawlaa Wa-ni'man naseer

41.t: Know that whatever property you may gain, one fifth belongs to God, the Messenger, the kindred, orphans, the needy and those who need money while on a journey. (This is the law) if you believe in God and what We revealed to Our Servant on the Day of Distinction (Badr) when the armies confronted each other. God has power over all things.
41.tr: Wa'lamooo annamaa ghanimtum min sha'in fa-anna lillaahi khumusahoo Wa-lir-Rasooli Wa-lizil qurba walyataamaa walmasaakeeni wabnis sabeeli in kuntum aamantum billaahi Wa-maaa anzalnaa 'ala 'abdinaa yawmal Furqaani yawmal taqal jam'aan; wal-laahu 'alaa kulli shai'in Qadeer

42.t: Recall when your army was positioned at the less defensible brink of the valley, (the pagans') army had the more defensible higher side of the valley and the caravan was led (out of your reach) below. This situation did not take place according to your previous plans, otherwise, everything would have been different. (It was God's plan) to place you in a vulnerable position, exposed to the enemy and it was His plan to lead the caravan out of your reach) so that His decree that you would be granted a victory by a miracle would become a doubtless fact and so that those who were to be destroyed would face destruction with a clear knowledge of the Truth and those who were to survive would also survive with a clear knowledge of the Truth. God is All-hearing and All-knowing.
42.tr: Iz antum bil'udwatid dunyaa Wa-hum bil'udwatil quswaa warrakbu asfala minkum; Wa-law tawaa'attum lakhtalaftum fil mee'aadi Wa-laakil liyaqdiyal laahu amran kaana maf'oolal liyahlika man halaka 'am baiyinatinw Wa-yahyaa man haiya 'am baiyinah; Wa-innal laaha la-Samee'un 'Aleem

43.t: In your dream, God showed (the pagans' army) as being only a few in number, for if He had showed them as a great number, you would have lost courage and would have started to quarrel among yourselves concerning this matter. But God saved you from that condition; He knows what is in your hearts.
43.tr: Iz yureekahumul laahu fee manaamika qaleela; Wa-law araakahum kaseeral lafashiltum Wa-latanaaza'tum fil amri Wa-laakinnal laaha sallam; innahoo 'aleemum bizaatis sudoor

44.t: When you met the pagans' army, God made them appear fewer in your eyes and you appear fewer in their eyes so that His miracle of granting you (an incredible) victory could easily be fulfilled. To God do all things return.
44.tr: Wa-iz yureekumoohum izil taqaitum feee a'yunikum qaleelanw Wa-yuqallilukum feee a'yunihim liyaqdiyal laahu amran kaana maf'oolaa; Wa-ilal laahi turja'ul umoor

45.t: Believers, stand firm when you meet a band of your enemy and remember God often so that you may have everlasting happiness.
45.tr: Yaaa-aiyuhal lazeena aamanooo izaa laqeetum fi'atan fasbutoo wazkurul laaha kaseeral la'allakum tuflihoon

46.t: Obey God and His Messenger. Do not quarrel with each other lest you fail or lose honor. Exercise patience; God is with those who have patience.
46.tr: Wa-atee'ul laaha Wa-Rasoolahoo Wa-laa tanaaza'oo fatafshaloo Wa-tazhaba reehukum wasbiroo; innal laaha ma'as saabireen

47.t: Do not be like those who marched out boastfully to show off their strength to people and hinder people from the way of God. God encompasses everyone's activities.
47.tr: Wa-laa takoonoo kallazeena kharajoo min diyaarihim bataranw Wa-ri'aaa'an naasi Wa-yasuddoona 'an sabeelil laah; wallaahu bimaa ya'maloona muheet

48.t: Satan made their (pagans') deeds seem attractive to them and said to them, "No one today is more powerful than you and I am your supporter." But when the two armies confronted one another and the pagans were defeated, then satan betrayed his friends saying, "I am not with you any more; I see what you do not see and I am afraid of God." God is severe in His retribution.
48.tr: Wa-iz zaiyana lahumush shaitaanu a'ma-alahum Wa-qaala laa ghaaliba lakumul yawma minan naasi Wa-innee jaarul lakum falammaa taraaa'atil fi'ataani nakasa 'alaa aqibaihi Wa-qaala innee bareee'um minkum innee araa maa laa tarawna inneee akhaaful laah; wallaahu shadeedul 'iqaab

49.t: The hypocrites and those whose hearts are sick, say, "The (believers') religion has deceived them." Those who trust in God will find Him Majestic and All-wise.
49.tr: Iz yaqoolul munaafiqoona wallazeena fee quloobihim maradun gharra haaa'ulaaa'i deenuhum; Wa-mai yatawakkal 'alal laahi fa-innal laaha 'azee-zun Hakeem

50.t: Would that you could have seen the angels taking the souls of the unbelievers away from their bodies and smiting their faces and their backs saying, "Suffer the burning torment.
50.tr: Wa-law taraaa iz yatawaf-fal lazeena kafarul malaaa'ikatu yadriboona wujoohahum Wa-adbaarahum Wa-zooqoo 'azaabal hareeq

51.t: This is the result of their deeds. God is not unjust to His servants."
51.tr: Zaalika bimaa qaddamat aideekum Wa-anal laaha laisa bizallaamil lil-'abeed

52.t: The same thing happened to the people of Pharaoh and those who lived before them. They rejected the revelations of God and, because of their sins, His retribution struck them. God is All-powerful and stern in His retribution.
52.tr: Kadaabi Aali Fir'awna wal-lazeena min qablihim; kafaroo bi-Aayaatil laahi fa-akhazahu-mul laahu bizunoobihim; innal laaha qawiyyun shadeedul 'iqaab

53.t: God does not change the favor that He has bestowed on a nation unless that nation changes what is in its soul. God is All-hearing and All-knowing.
53.tr: Zaalika bi-annal laaha lam yakumu ghaiyiran ni'matan an'amahaa 'alaa qawmin hattaa yughaiyiroo maa bianfusihim Wa-annal laaha samee'un 'Aleem

54.t: Like the people of the Pharaoh and those who lived before them, (the unbelievers) rejected the revelations of God. We destroyed them for their sins and drowned the people of Pharaoh. They were all unjust.
54.tr: Kadaabi Aali Fir'awna wallazeena min qablihim; kazzaboo bi-Aayaati Rabbihim faahlaknaahum bizunoobihim Wa-aghraqnaa Aala Fir'awn; Wa-kullun kaanoo zaalimeen

55.t: The most wicked creatures in the sight of God are the unbelievers who never have faith,
55.tr: Inna sharrad dawaaabbi 'indal laahil lazeena kafaroo fahum laa yu'minoon

56.t: who make promises but break them every time, and who have no piety.
56.tr: Allazeena 'aahatta min-hum summa yanqudoona 'ahdahum fee kulli marratinw Wa-hum laa yattaqoon

57.t: When you capture the (unbelievers) during a fight, teach them a lesson so that they thereafter will always be aware of the threat of your power.
57.tr: Fa-immaa tasqafannahum fil harbi fasharrid bihim man khalfahum la'allahum yazzakkaroon

58.t: If you are afraid of the treachery of some of your allies, you may disregard your treaty with them. God does not love the treacherous ones.
58.tr: Wa-immaa takhaafana min qawmin khiyaanatan fambiz ilaihim 'alaa sawaaa'; innal laaha laa yuhibbul khaaa'ineen

59.t: The unbelievers should not think that they can really escape Us or that they can never be defeated.
59.tr: Wa-laa yahsabannal lazeena kafaroo sabaqooo; innahum laa yu'jizoon

60.t: Mobilize your (defensive) force as much as you can to frighten the enemies of God and your own enemies. This also will frighten those who are behind them whom you do not know but God knows well. Whatever you spend for the cause of God, He will give you sufficient recompense with due justice.
60.tr: Wa-a'iddoo lahum mas tata'tum min quwwatinw Wa-mir ribaatil khaili turhiboona bihee 'aduwwal laahi Wa-'aduwwakum Wa-aakhareena min doonihim laa ta'lamoo-nahum Allaahu ya'lamuhum; Wa-maa tunfiqoo min shai'in fee sabeelil laahi yuwaffa ilaikum Wa-antum laa tuzlamoon

61.t: If they (the unbelievers) propose peace, accept it and trust in God. God is All-hearing and All-knowing.
61.tr: Wa-in janahoo lissalmi fajnah lahaa Wa-tawakkal 'alal laah; innahoo Huwas Samee'ul 'Aleem

62.t: If they want to deceive you, God is All-sufficient for you. It is God who supported you with His own help and with that of the believers,
62.tr: Wa-iny yureedooo any yakhda'ooka fainna hasbakal laah; Huwal lazeee aiyadaka binasrihee Wa-bilmu'mineen

63.t: among whose hearts He has placed affection and unity. If you were to spend the wealth of the whole earth, you would not have been able to unite their hearts but God has been able to unite them. God is Majestic and All-wise.
63.tr: Wa-allafa baina quloobihim; law anfaqta maa fil ardi jamee'am maaa allafta baina quloobihim Wa-laakinnal laaha allafa bainahum; innaahoo 'Azeezun Hakeem

64.t: Prophet, God and the believers who follow you are sufficient support for you.
64.tr: Yaaa-aiyuhan Nabiyyu hasbukal laahu Wa-manit taba'aka minal mu'mineen

65.t: Prophet, mobilize the believers for the battle. It will take only twenty of your men who are steadfast (in prayer) to defeat two hundred unbelieving men. Your two hundred men would defeat their two thousand; the unbelievers have no understanding.
65.tr: Yaaa-aiyuhan Nabiyyu harridil mu'mineena 'alal qitaal; iny yakum minkum 'ishroona saabiroona yaghliboo mi'atayn; Wa-iny yakum minkum min'atuny yaghlibooo alfam minal lazeena kafaroo bi-anahum qawmul laa yafqahoon

66.t: Now that God has eased your burden, He has found you to be weak. A hundred of your steadfast men would defeat two hundred of theirs and a thousand of yours would defeat two thousand of the unbelievers, by the will of God. God is with those who have patience.
66.tr: Al'aana khaffafal laahu 'ankum Wa-'alima anna feekum da'faa; fa-iny yakum minkum mi'atun saabiratuny yaghliboo mi'atayn; Wa-iny yakum minkum alfuny yaghlibooo alfaini bi-iznil laah; wallaahu ma'as saabireen

67.t: The Prophet is not supposed to take any captives to strengthen his position on the earth. You want worldly gains but God wants the life hereafter for you. God is Majestic and All-wise.
67.tr: Maa kaana li-Nabiyyin ai yakoona lahooo asraa hatta yuskhina fil ard; tureedoona aradad dunyaa wallaahu yureedul Aakhirah; wallaahu 'Azeezun Hakeem

68.t: (Had you taken captives) before being allowed by God's revelations, a great torment would have struck you for what you had done.
68.tr: Law-laa Kitaabum minal laahi sabaqa lamassakum fee-maaa akhaztum 'azaabun 'azeem

69.t: Use what you have acquired (from the battle) as your own good, lawful property. Have fear of God; He is All-forgiving and All-merciful.
69.tr: Fakuloo mimaa ghanimtum halaalan taiyibaa; watta qullaah; innal laaha Ghafoorur Raheem

70.t: Prophet, tell the captives with you, "If God finds anything good in your hearts, He will give you a better reward than that which was taken from you and will forgive you. God is All-forgiving and All-merciful.
70.tr: Yaaa-aiyuhan Nabiyyu qul liman feee aideekum minal asraaa iny ya'lamil laahu fee quloobikum khairany yu'tikum khayram mimmaaa ukhiza minkum Wa-yaghfir lakum; wallaahu Ghafoorur Raheem

71.t: Do not be surprised that they want to be dishonest with you; they have always been dishonest with God. However, He has power over them. God is All-knowing and All-wise.
71.tr: Wa-iny yureedoo khiyaa-nataka faqad khaanul laaha min qablu fa-amkana minhum; wallaahu 'Aleemun Hakeem

72.t: The believers who left their homes and strove for the cause of God, through their property and in person and those who gave refuge to them and helped them will be each other's guardians. The believers who did not leave their homes are not your guardians until they too leave their homes. If they ask you for help in a religious cause, you must help them against their enemies unless their enemies have a peace treaty with you. God is Well Aware of what you do.
72.tr: Innal lazeena aamanoo Wa-haajaroo Wa-jaahadoo bi-amwaalihim Wa-anfusihim fee sabeelil laahi wallazeena aawaw Wa-nasarooo ulaaa'ika ba'duhum awliyaaa'u ba'd; wallazeena aamanoo Wa-lam yuhaajiroo maa lakum minw walaayatihim min shai'in hatta yuhaajiroo; Wa-inis tansarookum fid deeni fa'alaiku munnasru illaa 'alaa qawmin bainakum Wa-bainahum meesaaq; wallaahu bimaa ta'maloona Baseer

73.t: The unbelievers are each other's friends. If you (the believers) do not keep the same among yourselves in the land, there will come into being widespread idolatry and great evil.
73.tr: Wallazeena kafaroo ba'duhum awliyaaa'u ba'd; illaa taf'aloohu takun fitnatun fil ardi Wa-fasaadun kabeer

74.t: The believers who left their homes, and strove for the cause of God and those who gave them refuge and helped them, are true believers. They will have forgiveness (from their Lord) and (will be granted) honorable provisions.
74.tr: Wallazeena aamanoo Wa-haajaroo Wa-jaahadoo fee sabeelil laahi wallazeena aawaw Wa-nasarooo ulaaa'ika humul mu'minoona haqqaa; lahum maghfiratunw Wa-rizqun kareem

75.t: Those who accepted the faith later, left their homes and strove with you for the cause of God are also your people. They relatives are nearer to each other according to the Book of God. God has knowledge of all things.
75.tr: Wallazeena aamanoo min ba'du Wa-haajaroo Wa-jaahadoo ma'akum fa-Ulaaa'ika minkum; Wa-ulul arhaami baduhum awlaa biba'din fee Kitaabil laah; innal laaha bikulli shai'in 'Aleem
